text: easy 2004 we met at our 10-year reunion
I went to college in Atlanta at a
historically black college for women
called Spelman and Anthony went to the
men's college called Morehouse but we
didn't actually know each other in
school we both moved to New York at the
same time and took jobs on Wall Street
we had a lot of friends in common
Anthony remembers the story a little bit
better than I do but I think he came
over to me I think I was standing sort
of in the you know in off to the corner
maybe I had a drink or something I went
over and said hey how are you doing
what's up and we wound up talking for a
very very very long time that night I
didn't know what to make of it because I
lived in New York he lived in California
and it just it felt like that was a
great conversation he seems like a
really great guy
that he was in California so a couple
months later in July Anthony and one of
his best friends Mike were coming to New
York for the holiday weekend the minute
I say Cristal she says ah imagine seeing
you here and I said well imagine seeing
you here he was actually in town because
he was interviewing for a position in
New York and that went on for about a
month or so and whenever he came to New
York we would get together and have
dinner and he ended up getting an offer
from this company and another company in
Florida at the same time so in a matter
of 11 let's say 12 days I packed up
everything from San Francisco and moved
to New York for me it was great because
he was new to the city he had friends
here but he and I spent a lot of time
together one of the first things that he
told me I guess when we first started
dating we said he'd always wanted to run
a marathon she says well guess what
we're running a marathon I said we are
you French come on Tagliabue you know
what what do you mean we're running a
marathon
I entered our names in the lottery on a
lark thinking that there was no way we'd
get picked and if anything made
one of us would get picked and not the
other and the lottery results came out
on June 15th and Anthony's birthday is
June 16th and I checked at midnight when
the website went live and we both got
picked we we spent three months training
it was just she and I and she got hurt I
went to the doctor and he told me that
he thought I would be okay but I would
probably just have to run was slower
than I'd anticipated you know she got
out there and I could see the pain and
anguish in her face and we were running
slower than we typically would have run
but I didn't think it would be fair to
leave her I remember crossing the line
with him and just feeling very close to
him and feeling really grateful and
amazed that he had made that sacrifice
to finish with me and not do his best
even though he could have I think it was
pretty clear that we were moving down
the path of being together forever I was
probably a little more articulate about
it than he was my birthday's in December
so it's right before Christmas he called
me at work he told me to meet him at a
restaurant that we like in Midtown and
when I got off the subway he had left me
a message and said that something was
going on at that restaurant and to meet
him at Lake colonial and that was the
restaurant where we had our first date
during the dinner I gave the ring to the
waiter when the waiter brought the
dessert out the ring was in the dessert
but I didn't see it because I wasn't
looking for it so we're talking again
and Anthony told me that he was gonna go
to the restroom I learned how to propose
from Google believe it or not I said how
how do you propose and there's a website
telling guys how to propose so I'm on my
knee and pulled up a pants leg I'm down
there his lips were moving but you know
I didn't hear anything so I was just in
such shock and I'm saying will you be my
wife and she goes you haven't asked me
anything and I'm like oh god please will
you marry me and finally she said yes
and the restaurant I clapped and it was
a good day
very good I mean I admire you I respect
you but most importantly I love you no
no leave it you because you thought
about that you always have to ruin it I
know right
